page.title: 11HOUSING
page.content: I am a pupil at Bishop Goodwin Junior School, in Carlisle. Opposite our school there is a row of terraced houses. You can tell this because they are all joined together. On my street all the houses are semi-detached. This means one building is split into two houses. Some people have mansions. They are very big houses which have a lot more rooms in them than ordinary houses. You could fit more people into a mansion then in an ordinary house. Sometimes if there is only one person they live in a flat, because one person does not need a lot of room and it may be less expensive to heat and a lot easier to keep clean and tidy. Some cities have tower blocks containing many flats, but Carlisle does not have any at all.
